snippet: Thornton, the former White Sox and Red Sox pitcher, will replace Boone Logan as the main left-hander in the bullpen.
abstract: New York Yankees cut outfielder Vernon Wells in order to make room for left-handed relief pitcher Matt Thornton, who signs two-year, $7 million deal.
lead_paragraph: Thornton, the former White Sox and Red Sox pitcher, will replace Boone Logan as the main left-hander in the bullpen.

headline.main: Yankees Sign Reliever (Matt Thornton) and Cut Outfielder (Vernon Wells)
headline.print_headline: Yankees Sign Reliever (Thornton) and Cut Outfielder (Wells)
